resources.string: Failed to prepare the camera. The device may not support the function to use the front and rear cameras at the same time. Please try using a relatively recent device (a device with Android 11 or later pre-installed).
An unknown error occurred. Please try restarting the app.
You can activate the front and rear cameras at the same time.
It is likely available on relatively recent devices (devices that come pre-installed with Android 11 or later).
Please grant permission. The camera is for shooting purposes and the microphone is for recording video.
Drag to move, pinch in/out to zoom in/out
If the camera fails to start
Compared to conventional video (SDR), you can record with more brightness and color. \nSimply put, you can record \"dazzling video.\"
It is said that using HEVC will cut the capacity in half at the expense of compatibility.
The amount of data used per second. Increasing the bit rate will improve image quality, but the file size will also increase.

Compared to conventional video (SDR), HDR allows you to shoot with more brightness and color.
 Simply put, you can shoot "dazzling video".
 
 Videos shot in HDR will be played back with roughly the same color and brightness as when they were shot when viewed on a display that supports HDR.
 However, if the display does not support HDR, the colors tend to be whitish overall.
 
 Therefore, we recommend turning off this function if you are using it for the following purposes.
 ・When playing on a display that does not support HDR
 ・When the video sharing site does not support HDR
 ・When using for video editing (unless the video editing app supports HDR)
 
 Currently, the only video codec is HEVC (H.265).
 
 Information for experts
 ・HDR format is HLG
 ・Gamma curve is HLG
 ・Color space is BT.2020
